content.title: National Award For Senior Citizens (vayoshreshtha Samman): Best Institution For Research In The Field Of Ageing
content.department: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
content.beneficiary: Institutions and organizations involved in research and service for senior citizens
content.details: Every year, the Department of Social Justice and Empowerment, Government of India confers the 'National Award for Senior Citizens (Vayoshreshtha Samman)' to eminent and outstanding senior citizens and institutions/organizations involved in rendering distinguished service for the cause of elderly persons, especially indigent senior citizens. The awards are conferred on 1st October every year by the Hon’ble President of India at Vigyan Bhawan, New Delhi. The 'Vayoshreshtha Samman: Best Institution for Research in the Field of Ageing' award shall be given to institutions with a record of outstanding work in research and dissemination of knowledge in the field of ageing.
benefits: Boarding and lodging expenses for awardees and one companion
Reimbursement of to-and-fro travelling expenses and accommodation
eligibility: Registered body with a minimum of five years of experience in the field of ageing
Remarkable achievements in research or publication in the field of elderly in India
Outstanding achievements in education and training in the field of Ageing or Geriatric care
Instrumental in developing policies and programmes for Senior Citizens
Dissemination of knowledge and creating awareness on issues relating to the elderly
Participatory leadership in the community and civil society in the field of ageing
documents_required: Proof of Parent Organisation or Registered Body
Details of the Managing Committee and Qualification of their Members
Details of NGO working at Regional/State/National/International Level
Total staff strength of the NGO
Annual Reports for the last 3 years
Special or Outstanding Achievements during the last 5 years
Details of Awards or Honours received

faqs.question: What are the objectives of this scheme?
faqs.answer: To honour eminent and outstanding senior citizens and institutions/organizations involved in rendering distinguished service for the cause of elderly persons.

faqs.question: When are these awards conferred?
faqs.answer: The awards are conferred on 1st October every year.

faqs.question: Who confers these awards?
faqs.answer: The awards are conferred by the Hon’ble President of India.

faqs.question: How many categories are there in this award?
faqs.answer: The Awards are given across 13 categories: 07 Institutional Categories and 06 categories of individual type.

faqs.question: Can I nominate myself for this award?
faqs.answer: No, Self-nominations for the Awards shall not be considered.
